----

#AsiaArtCenter has long established itself as a key advocate for post-war modern masters and is honoured to present works by three seminal figures in post-war Taiwanese art â€“ #YuyuYANG (1926â€“1997), #CHUWeibor (1929â€“2018), and #JUMing (1938â€“2023) â€“ at #Frieze Seoul, one of the most prestigious art fairs in the world. The gallery engaged in sustained collaboration with each of these artists over many years prior to assuming formal representation of their estates. Through sustained research and international engagement, Asia Art Center has helped position their practices within the evolving narrative of Taiwanese modern and contemporary art. 

The works presented date from 1962, the height of Taiwanâ€™s avant-garde movements such Fifth Moon and Ton Fan art groups which Yuyu Yang and Chu Weibor were respectively associated with, to Ju Mingâ€™s evolution of the â€˜Taichi Arch Seriesâ€™ in 1998, spanning nearly four decades. Together, they trace a critical arc in Taiwanese art history, a period when artists not only assimilated Western influences but also championed local cultural expression. Their enduring legacies continue to inform and inspire contemporary art practice today.
